ans.reasoning: The isValid method is the entry point for validation and directly calls the Cleaner class to check if the parsed document is valid. If there is an issue with the validation logic or the Cleaner class, it will directly affect the test results.

The isValid method in the Cleaner class checks if the document is valid by counting discarded nodes. If the logic for counting or copying nodes is flawed, it could lead to incorrect validation results.

The copySafeNodes method is responsible for copying safe nodes from the source to the destination. If it incorrectly identifies nodes as unsafe or fails to copy them properly, it could lead to a higher number of discarded nodes, affecting the validation outcome.

The parseBodyFragment method is responsible for parsing the HTML input. If it fails to parse the input correctly, it could lead to invalid documents being passed to the validation logic, but it is less likely to be the direct cause of the test failure.
This method also parses the body fragment but is less critical than the previous methods since it is a helper method. Any issues here would likely propagate through the other methods.
The isSafeTag method checks if a tag is safe. While important, it is a simple check and less likely to be the source of the problem unless the tagNames set is incorrectly populated.

The isSafeAttribute method checks if an attribute is safe. Similar to isSafeTag, it is a straightforward check and less likely to be the source of the issue unless there are problems with the attributes map.
